DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this clinical research study is to learn if BMS-512148 (Dapagliflozin) can help reduce the blood sugar levels in subjects with Type 2 Diabetes who are not well controlled on TZD alone. The safety of this treatment will also be studied
DOC.criteria: Males and females, ≥ 18 years old, with type 2 diabetes and with inadequate glycemic control All subjects must have central laboratory prerandomization A1C ≥ 7.0 and ≤ 10.5% Cpeptide ≥ 1.0 ng/mL (0.34 nmol/L) Body Mass Index ≤ 45.0 kg/m² AST and /or ALT > 2.5 times the upper limit of normal Serum total bilirubin > 2 mg/dL (34.2 µmol/L) Creatinine kinase > 3.0 times the upper limit of normal Symptoms of severely uncontrolled diabetes Serum creatinine ≥ 2.0 mg/dL Calculated CrClearance < 50 ml/min (calculated by CockroftGault formula) Currently unstable or serious cardiovascular, renal, hepatic, hematological, oncological, endocrine, psychiatric, or rheumatic diseases
